image.altText: Three boys in school uniform walk through the gates of a school building with a sign reading "St Edmund's College Canberra".

props.synopsis: Prosecutors argue former Canberra student teacher Petra Shasha should face jail time for the persistent sexual abuse of a 15-year-old boy, who she met working as a trainee teacher at St Edmund's College.

title.children: Former student teacher should be jailed for child sex abuse, court hears

image.altText: A man wearing handcuffs

props.synopsis: A convicted killer will test the limits of Queensland's 'no body, no parole' law in the High Court today, after being denied his freedom because authorities say he won't reveal where they can find the body of his stepdaughter.

title.children: Double murderer to challenge 'no body, no parole' law in High Court

image.altText: Paper lanterns floating on still water, seen from above.

props.synopsis: The American company behind a Canberra water lantern festival apologises for using the Commonwealth Coat of Arms without approval, and promises to issue refunds to hundreds of ticketholders if it can't secure a new venue.

title.children: Lantern festival promises refunds if  Canberra event can't go ahead

image.altText: Unidentified guard opens secure door at Youth Justice centre

props.synopsis: A former youth offender sues the ACT government, alleging he was sexually assaulted by a guard at the former Quamby youth detention centre.

title.children: ACT government sued over alleged sexual assault by youth detention guard

image.altText: The exterior of a concrete building with the words "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory" over the entrance.

props.synopsis: The court heard the victim had declined help or to pursue the matter with police at the time of the alleged assault, telling them he'd been "kicked by a horse".

title.children: Second Canberra man charged over 2020 death after family barbecue

image.altText: blurry shot of a man and woman sitting on a park bench

props.synopsis: Chris has been using cannabis for the majority of his adult life, and says he used to get behind the wheel while under the influence, but it isn't something he does anymore.

title.children: Chris used to drive after smoking cannabis, but not anymore

image.altText: Jacob Vadakkedathu, Peter Dutton

props.synopsis: The Liberal Party's lead Senate candidate for the ACT has broken his silence over allegations of branch stacking, after a push to disendorse him failed at the weekend.

title.children: Liberal Senate candidate denies branch stacking claims

image.altText: The wallet lies open on a bench, its contents displayed, including the Video Ezy card.

props.synopsis: When Tim Caesar's wallet flew out his car window at 19 he thought it was gone forever, but three decades later a stranger reunited it with him through a local Facebook group after fishing it out of the Queabeyan River.

title.children: Video Ezy cards, 'decimated' money in 30yo wallet fished from river

image.altText: Lachlan smiles after his run, holding up a medal.

props.synopsis: Despite Australia's rich history on the world indoor athletics stage, it still doesn't have an indoor facility.

title.children: Australia doesn't have an indoor athletics track, but this event is a short-term answer

image.altText: Damage to roads and boats in Cardwell in north Queensland.

props.synopsis: Conditions are starting to ease across north Queensland but authorities have warned the risk of dangerous flooding remains. Look back on our live coverage.

title.children: Townsville residents return home as rain eases in north Queensland — as it happened

image.altText: Journalist Antoinette Lattouf, centre, arrives at the Federal Court of Australia with two male lawyers either side of her

props.synopsis: Freelance journalist Antoinette Lattouf recalled being given a suggestion to "keep a low profile" on social media but said she was not directed to avoid posting on social media altogether.

title.children: Antoinette Lattouf tells court she wasn't directed to avoid social media

image.altText: A specialist checks the skin of a patient.

props.synopsis: When specialist referrals expire, some patients are being charged twice for more costly initial consultations, despite their care being ongoing. Health experts say it's a potentially illegal practice that's costing patients.

title.children: Repeat referrals are costing Medicare and patients

image.altText: Australian gold and silver coins on top of Australian notes.

props.synopsis: The ASX200 lost ground after China announced a package of tariffs on a range of US products in an immediate response to a 10 per cent tariff on Chinese imports announced by US President Donald Trump. Catch up on the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Australian shares lose ground but Aussie dollar rebounds — as it happened

image.altText: A chicken parmigiana sits atop chips and a side salad on a white plate, which is on a wooden bench

props.synopsis: Labor says the Coalition's election policy to offer tax-free lunches would cost the federal budget $1.6 billion a year, enlisting the Treasury in a political attack on the small business support measure Treasurer Jim Chalmers says would "smash the budget".

title.children: Angus Taylor says Treasury costing of his lunch policy 'egregious politicisation'

image.altText: Elon Musk standing behind a podium, raising his fists in the air and shouting.

props.synopsis: The Tesla and SpaceX owner is now considered a "special government employee" as he works to shrink the US government, potentially bypassing conflict of interest and financial disclosure laws.

title.children: Musk made 'special government employee' as USAID closed down

image.altText: A series of crosses placed in the ground at a memorial. A sign reads "Reagan Airport vigil".

props.synopsis: When Ronald Reagan fired 11,000 Federal Aviation Administraton staff in the 1980s he set the organisation on a troubled path. Donald Trump is just the latest politician to question the body.

title.children: 'Ill-informed': The problem with Trump's air traffic control comments

image.altText: A woman with a white suit jacket and bangs gives a solemn press conference

props.synopsis: NSW Transport Minister Jo Haylen has resigned over her use of a ministerial driver for private trips.

title.children: NSW transport minister resigns, acknowledges 'damage' caused

image.altText: Dale Tapping at a press conference, standing and looking at reporters

props.synopsis: Dale Tapping was diagnosed with the aggressive form of blood cancer in January 2023 and died on Tuesday at the age of 59, the club said.

title.children: AFL world mourns after death of Bombers and Lions assistant coach

image.altText: Troy Selwood of the Lions runs with the ball

props.synopsis: Former Brisbane Lions player Troy Selwood, brother of Geelong premiership captain Joel, has died aged 40.

title.children: Family 'heartbroken' by sudden death of former AFL player Troy Selwood

image.altText: A smiling man wearing a suit embraces a woman wearing a football uniform

props.synopsis: The kiss following Spain's Women's World Cup win became a reckoning for Spanish soccer, with several of the sport's former top male officials on trial in Madrid.

title.children: Jenni Hermoso tells court she 'never' consented to Luis Rubiales kiss

image.altText: A young man with a sunburned face except around his eyes, where his sunglasses were.

props.synopsis: If you think the Australian summer sun feels harsher than a summer in the Northern Hemisphere, you're not wrong. But why that's the case may surprise you.

title.children: Australia's UV levels are high, but the ozone hole isn't the culprit

image.altText: Close up of red and green numbers on ASX board

props.synopsis: Hundreds of Australian companies are set reveal how much money they have earned or lost against the backdrop of major uncertainty from Trump's America.

title.children: 'Opportunity for investors' as Australian companies reveal profits

image.altText: Close-up of Nicole Kidman and Sophie Wilde smiling

props.synopsis: Since her breakout role in A24's Talk to Me, Sophie Wilde has been the lead in a Netflix series, won an AACTA and been nominated for BAFTA's Rising Star Award. We caught up with Sophie to mark the release of her new film, Babygirl, hear more about her music obsessions, and to compel her to change her passwords.

title.children: Babygirl actor Sophie Wilde wants to go clubbing with Nicole Kidman

image.altText: A close up of a young woman with black hair and white glasses looking away.

props.synopsis: After doctors dismissed Rheanca's pain because they couldn't see where it hurt, she knew people with disability in regional areas needed a space to connect. She is one of Heywire's 2025 Trailblazers winners.

title.children: Meet the 2025 Trailblazers making a difference in regional Australia

image.altText: Mary Fowler warming up before a match, looking at the crowd

props.synopsis: A rejuvenated and in-form Mary Fowler has been named to return to the Matildas set-up after opting to withdraw from the side's most recent international window.

title.children: Fowler back in green and gold for Matildas

props.synopsis: The US Army Corps of Engineers recovers parts of a plane wreckage from the Potomac River after an American Airlines plane collides with a military Black Hawk helicopter over Washington, DC.

title.children: American Airlines engine recovered from Potomac River in DC plane crash

image.altText: Soldiers load a portable howitzer.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump says he wants "equalisation" from Ukraine for "close to $US300 billion" in military aid, as outnumbered Ukrainian troops lose ground to Russia.

title.children: Russian troops gaining ground as Trump offers trade deal to Ukraine

image.altText: A close-up of a young Taiwanese woman smiling.

props.synopsis: The TV host and star of popular TV drama Meteor Garden dies after contracting pneumonia triggered by the flu.

title.children: Taiwanese star Barbie Hsu dies of flu aged 48

image.altText: A sign reading supreme court

props.synopsis: Prosecutors have dropped a case against Victorian woman Ilknur Caliskan who claimed to be asleep when she stabbed her husband to death during a camping trip in 2023.

title.children: Case dropped against Victorian woman who killed husband in her sleep

image.altText: Aerial photo of end of island with aqua ocean rocky edge

props.synopsis: South Australia's fourth-largest island is set to become an ark for mammal species recovery, funded by $4.8 million from governments including ridding the island of rats, mice, and cats.

title.children: $4.8 million pledged to return island to the wild to save threatened species

image.altText: A woman holds a $50 note and two $20 notes for a story about superannuation.

props.synopsis: Topping up your super can boost your retirement savings, but with so many competing financial priorities, how do you know when it's the right time to contribute?

title.children: What to consider before making voluntary super contributions

image.altText: two carton eggs

props.synopsis: Police will allege in court that inquiries revealed the attack was random after a group of young women in Sydney's east reported having eggs thrown at them over the weekend.

title.children: Egging of women in Bondi not antisemitic, police say

image.altText: GettyImages-1164334122

props.synopsis: Australian cricket star Usman Khawaja defends journalist Peter Lalor after the veteran cricket reporter was dumped by SEN over Palestinian posts.

title.children: Khawaja defends cricket journalist who was dumped over Palestinian posts

image.altText: Jack Robinson sitting on the beach looking out at the ocean

props.synopsis: The wait continues at the Pipe Pro with competition remaining on hold, however more favourable surf conditions are forecast for Hawaii's North Shore.

title.children: Surfers continue waiting game as Pipe Pro delay drags on

image.altText: A composite image of NFL players Patrick Mahomes and Saquon Barkely with Taylorn Swift

props.synopsis: Whether you're a die-hard football fan or a lover of the arts, here's everything you need to know about Superbowl LIX.

title.children: Super Bowl LIX: How to watch it, what time it kicks off and whether Taylor Swift will be there
